column4: could someone give me a hand at permissioning a svn repository?
#svn
i think it´s actually a permission problem... and not svn problem
file permission or svn-repo permission?
!upgrade | wonderwal
file permission
file permission from the files that are the repo, actually
and what issue exactly? who is the owner? subversion is running as "svn"?
i keep getting: Can't open file '/var/local/portalJP/db/txn-current-lock': Permission denied, when i try to commit anything... even tho i have permission on that file
svn must have permissions, not you
subversion is running as root, the owner is svn:svn... and my user belongs to svn group... permissions are set 775
never ever!!! run svn as root
it´s just a local server
doesnt matter
ok, i´m already running it from svn user
any ideas what could be?
can you paste the permission of that file please
sorry for the delay... it´s -rwxrwxr-x 1 svn svn 0
strange, even svn should write into that
i know... that´s why i came here to ask
is there a way to log the file´s access? maybe it´s not using svn´s user?
